intro: Psychotria tsimihetensis, commonly known as the Tsimihetensis Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically in the understory of tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
